alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 11:32PM CDT until June 06 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Phillips and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dibble Creek, Ash Creek, Borin Creek, Bow Creek, North Fork Solomon River, East Branch Jim Creek, Cocklebur Creek, Jim Creek, Deer Creek, Kirwin Reservoir Area, South Fork Solomon River, Boxelder Creek, Sand Creek, Cactus Creek, Wolf Creek, Douglas Creek, Elm Creek, Medicine Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stockton, Logan, Kirwin, Woodston, Glade and Speed.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
